task_summary: Detect the green bottle on the right side of the table, approach and align the end-effector, then push it laterally and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator must push a green bottle resting on a tabletop among several other objects (red cylinder, blue can, orange items, small cubes). The arm begins near the table center and moves toward the right side where the green bottle sits close to the edge. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, safe approach above the surface, alignment before contact, and a controlled push followed by a short retreat to clear the object.
preconditions: Robot is homed and within workspace limits
Table surface is clear around the push path
Green bottle is present and visible or discoverable by scan
Gripper is open for non-grasp contact
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the green bottle or scan to locate it
Move to a safe height above the target
Approach and align to a side-contact pose
Execute a lateral push of fixed distance
Retreat to a safe clearance pose
success_criteria: Bottle exhibits displacement in commanded direction
No collisions with non-target objects beyond incidental contact
Robot retreats to a safe distance after push
failure_and_recovery: If target not visible, scan again (retry)
If approach/align times out, re-perceive and re-approach
If push stalls, re-align then push once more (future enhancement)
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after a single successful push and retreat sequence.

frame_5.now_evidence: Contact with the bottle and lateral motion are most apparent.
frame_5.predicts_next: Continued push or start of retreat is expected.

node_specs.description: Ensure open gripper for side pushing contact.
Checks if the green bottle is currently visible.
Active search when the bottle is not immediately visible.
Moves to a safe height above the bottle.
Side alignment for a stable push path.
Back off to clear the object after pushing.

failure_modes: Insufficient push distance due to friction
recovery_strategy: Re-approach with alignment if contact fails
Reduce speed and reattempt push after slight reposition (future extension)
assumptions: Push direction is to robot's right (~90Â°) based on frames showing motion toward table edge
Object category is a bottle; no grasp is required

expected_success_criteria: Bottle translates laterally by at least the commanded distance
Robot returns to a safe pose
